author: Patrick Allan
title: Ticketmaster Wants to Let You Buy Tickets Before Bots Snatch 'Em All Up
text:
Photo by swiminfan . 
You hear your favorite musical artist is coming to town, so you go to buy tickets only to find they’re already sold out. Those tickets weren’t picked up by people with faster fingers than you, though, they were purchased by bots to be resold. Ticketmaster’s “Verified Fan” program is hoping to change that. These bots are a major problem for all parties involved. In fact, scalpers generate an estimated $8 billion in secondary sales every year. That means higher ticket prices for you, and less money for approved sellers and artists. The “Verified Fan” program helps resolve the issue by registering actual fans via event pages, social media, email, or on the artist’s website. Once you get verified, you’ll be able to buy presale tickets before the bots can swoop in. Advertisement Advertisement 
Ticketmaster tested the program with some small tours earlier this year, and so far it’s worked pretty well. David Marcus, the head of music in North America at Ticketmaster, told Recode that less than 1% of tickets sold through the program ended up being resold. Now they’re the program is branching out with this week’s Ed Sheeran presale tickets, and looking to expand even more. 
To register, you have to check each individual event to see if Verified Fan presale is available . If it is, you sign up with your personal info via the Ticketmaster event page, the artist’s website, social media page, or Ticketmaster artist mailing list. Registrants will then be randomly selected. If you get selected, they send you a code via text message , which you can use to buy presale tickets.
